text: Oho, I didn't see this one coming! I miss Golden Sun...may have to replay.

text: You ever played the originals?
author: The Goldsmith

text: +Jake Smith I did. The first game really takes me back to when I got my GBA yeeeears ago :).
author: greenyxi

text: I like the theme from the second one when entering the password a lot better, they're the same, but I guess I'm kind of biased.
author: Xedhadeaus

text: So much intense memories. I will always love you, Golden Sun.
author: 4lucc

text: The problem with that is that the creators don't even want to do a sequel. They said that if the fans want it then they'll try, but it seems they think making rpgs is too stressful or something. I feel like the quality wouldn't be there anyway when a creator doesn't have a passion for making a game anymore.
author: Wilbum Noburn

text: @SupraDarky . Have you ever played Golden Sun for the GBA. It was much better and one of my favorite handheld games of all time.
author: Derick R

text: I really didn't like this game when I played it at launch, but looking back I would give it a B-. It's not a bad game, just very disappointing after the brilliance of the first two. My biggest gripe with the game was how much they talked about the old cast. I was waiting to meet Ivan and Piers the entire game and it never happened! I also think the playable character count was a bit too high. Each character never got the time s/he deserved.
author: swoosh870

text: It's a main resource of their money though
author: Season Leaves

text: I played the game with a djinn guide and i still missed a friggin summon! the rest was so easy i was thinking they were still introducing me to a lot of stuff and the real game would start any minute!
author: garfreeek

text: Oh, and the biggest flaw of the game...Camelot, stop making points of no return XD
author: Edwinillan

text: When I finished the half game Dark Dawn is, I just hoped it would have included a hard mode (the only really hard battle in the game is the final boss, if optional bosses aren't counted and if you are lvl 46 it's no problem really, thx pure wish), cool antagonists (except their battle theme which I like actually) and maybe a battle arena with the wifi connection...that would have been nice.
author: Edwinillan

text: I still enjoyed playing GS:DD despite its flaws. I just hope the next GS will be better. :)
author: AceAngelPrincess2431

text: The first two were amazing. I was a little let down by the third one. (what is with the animal people towns?) I liked it because it could feel human, but the way GS:DD went I just couldn't finish it all. I got so close to the end too. The sentiments of the third game were melancholy, I think if they do a fourth one, it wont be for awhile.
author: Laughing Man

text:
My favourite game trilogy ever! :D
I would so dearly love a fourth game. Please let us have one!
author: ladatree

text: The beginning of this game is abhorrent, but I just love this series.
author: Brainstrain91

text: yeah dullahan  was one tough son of a bitch, but really easy to beat if you know how to use your summons properly, the game ended on a cliffhanger, so who knows, there might be a sequel on the works
author: Iwannaplayssbb

text: Play the second one too.. imo the best in the series and one of my favourite games of all time.
author: Phenom Uprising

text: I really need to play that game, which I need to do right after I finish the first one.
author: BygPhattyPlus

text:
Loved this, but like Golden Sun 1, it felt like a prelude to the real events. Golden Sun 2 remains to this day one of my absolute favourite games of all time. It's pretty much just Okami I regard higher.
Awesome series. I want more. But a HD remake would be sweet too...
author: Dan Buck

text: Story, gameplay and characters needed to be more enjoyable.
author: cottonycloud

text: an awesome game ... you choose well
author: CÃ©sar Labra N

text: I love the series.  However, this game just made me mad.  Too  many "can't go back" moments, too many useless and pointless characters (this guy just sneezed, he joins the party!) and was pretty easy.
author: Rusa

text: I miss the older art style but the rest was what I expected, more or less.
author: Waywarde

text: While I sort-of like this series, there are some major flaws. Namely, there is too many cutscenes and almost nothing but talk happens in them. It feels like a Metal Gear Solid game only we don't get to see Snake be a badass from time to time. Also, as others have stated, most of the battles in the series is too easy. In DD, I really dislike the point of no returns, with the possibility of missing Summons/Djinni permanently if you weren't diligent enough along the way.
author: JessePrower

text: I don't think I'm gonna get the game because of the easy part... But if I do, I'll do a no-Djinn run on it to make it more challenging. Speaking about Golden Sun, I think I'm halfway through GS:TLA! :D
author: Jirt

text: Overall pretty easy battle-wise besides the final boss and super boss. The environments and puzzles were great though, and I really liked that each Djinni looked different.
author: Sephiko

text: The series' recurring main theme. This is the only game I brought with me when I took a vacation last summer and with such a nice setting, I think it made me enjoy it a lot more than I normally would have. I'd have prefered a niceï»¿ 2D artstyle and it's far from Sakuraba's best music. It's also way too easy, both the battles and the puzzles (except for the final optional boss who gave me a headache). Still, I fully completed this game and did everything 100% and that's usually a good sign.
author: SupraDarky
